badges.title: Artifact Evaluated
badges.description: Artifact Evaluated

badges.title: Artifact Evaluated - Passed
badges.description: Artifact Evaluated - Passed

badges.title: Artifacts Available
badges.description: Author-created artifacts relevant to this paper have been placed on a publically accessible archival repository. A DOI or link to this repository along with a unique identifier for the object is provided.

badges.title: Artifacts Available
badges.description: The artifacts associated with the paper have been made available for retrieval, permanently and publicly.

badges.title: Artifacts Available v1.1
badges.description: Author-created artifacts relevant to this paper have been placed on a publically accessible archival repository. A DOI or link to this repository along with a unique identifier for the object is provided.

badges.title: Artifacts Evaluated – Functional
badges.description: The artifacts associated with the research are found to be documented, consistent, complete, exercisable, and include appropriate evidence of verification and validation.

badges.title: Artifacts Evaluated – Functional v1.1
badges.description: The artifacts associated with the research are found to be documented, consistent, complete, exercisable, and include appropriate evidence of verification and validation.

badges.title: Artifacts Evaluated – Reusable
badges.description: The artifacts associated with the paper are of a quality that significantly exceeds minimal functionality. That is, they have all the qualities of the Artifacts Evaluated – Functional level, but, in addition, they are very carefully documented and well-structured to the extent that reuse and repurposing is facilitated. In particular, norms and standards of the research community for artifacts of this type are strictly adhered to.

badges.title: Artifacts Evaluated – Reusable v1.1
badges.description: The artifacts associated with the paper are of a quality that significantly exceeds minimal functionality. That is, they have all the qualities of the Artifacts Evaluated – Functional level, but, in addition, they are very carefully documented and well-structured to the extent that reuse and repurposing is facilitated. In particular, norms and standards of the research community for artifacts of this type are strictly adhered to.

badges.title: Artifacts Functional
badges.description: The artifacts conform to the expectations set by the paper in terms of functionality, usability, and relevance.

badges.title: Code Available
badges.description: Available: Code is available as a supplement to the document.

badges.title: Code Reviewed
badges.description: Available: Code is available as a supplement to the document.

badges.title: Datasets Available
badges.description: Available: Datasets are available as a supplement to the document.

badges.title: Datasets Reviewed
badges.description: Available: Datasets are available as a supplement to the document.

badges.title: Open Data
badges.description: The Open Data badge is awarded when digitally-shareable data necessary to reproduce the reported results are publicly available.

badges.title: Open Materials
badges.description: The Open Materials badge is earned by making publicly available the components of the research methodology needed to reproduce the reported procedure and analysis.

badges.title: Preregistered
badges.description: The Preregistered badge is earned for having a preregistered design. A preregistered design includes: (1) Description of the research design and study materials including planned sample size, (2) Description of motivating research question or hypothesis, (3) Description of the outcome variable(s), and (4) Description of the predictor variables including controls, covariates, independent variables (conditions). When possible, the study materials themselves are included in the preregistration.

badges.title: Preregistered+Analysis Plan
badges.description: The Preregistered+Analysis Plan badge is earned for having a preregistered research design (described above) and an analysis plan for the research and reporting results according to that plan. An analysis plan includes specification of the variables and the analyses that will be conducted. Guidance on construction of an analysis plan is below.

badges.title: Results Replicated
badges.description: The main results of the paper have been independently obtained in a subsequent study by a person or team other than the authors, without the use of author-supplied artifacts.

badges.title: Results Replicated
badges.description: The main results of the paper have been obtained in a subsequent study by a person or team other than the authors, using, in part, artifacts provided by the author.

badges.title: Results Reproduced
badges.description: The artifacts can be used to obtain the main results presented in the paper.

badges.title: Results Reproduced
badges.description: The main results of the paper have been independently obtained in a subsequent study by a person or team other than the authors, without the use of author-supplied artifacts.

badges.title: Results Reproduced v1.1
badges.description: The main results of the paper have been obtained in a subsequent study by a person or team other than the authors, using, in part, artifacts provided by the author.
